greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: row n (n >= 1) contains the numbers T(n,k) = Sum_{d|n} phi(d)*k^(n/d)/n, for k=1..n.
comment: T(n,k) is the number of n-bead necklaces with up to k different colored beads. - _Yves-Loic Martin_, Sep 29 2020
link: Index entries for sequences related to necklaces
formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{j=1..k} binomial(k,j) * A087854(n, j). - _Yves-Loic Martin_, Sep 29 2020
T(n,k) = (1/n) * Sum_{j=1..n} k^gcd(j, n). - _Seiichi Manyama_, Mar 10 2021
maple: A054631 := proc(n,k) add( numtheory[phi](d)*k^(n/d),d=numtheory[divisors](n) ) ;  %/n ; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 30 2011
mathematica: Needs["Combinatorica`"]; Table[Table[NumberOfNecklaces[n, k, Cyclic], {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, 8}] //Grid (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Oct 07 2012, after code by _T. D. Noe_ in A027671 *)
t[n_, k_] := Sum[EulerPhi[d]*k^(n/d)/n, {d, Divisors[n]}]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 1, 9}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 20 2014 *)
program: (PARI) T(n, k) = sumdiv(n, d, eulerphi(d)*k^(n/d))/n; \\ _Seiichi Manyama_, Mar 10 2021
(PARI) T(n, k) = sum(j=1, n, k^gcd(j, n))/n; \\ _Seiichi Manyama_, Mar 10 2021
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 16 2000, revised Mar 21 2007
